> I think it is problem of the JUnit plugin and not JUnit itself.

100% agree, is this the maillist for the junit eclipse plugin (or  
please redirect me if not... haven't found a spearate maillist)

> 2. In my eclipse (more precisely in my version of the JUnit plugin of
> eclipse, I see myTestMethodName[i], where i>=1, but for i=0 I see
> myTestMethodName. So, I can rerun this method easily.
Oddly that doesn't happen for me for i=0... strange... Do you have a  
patched or newer version of junit plugin? I'm using the one that comes  
with 3.4

>

> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "timdiggins" <subscribed@...> wrote:
>>
>> Hi -
>>
>> I'm using @RunWith(org.junit.runners.Parameterized.class) to have
>> parameterized tests.
>>
>> Tests run (and fail) fine. but when the error is reported it is
>> reported as myTestMethodName[0] or myTestMethodName[1] (according to
>> which parameter was used.
>>
>> This is fine for display, but unfortunately when Eclipse wants to  
>> find
>> the test, it is using this name and so if you double click on a
>> success/failure, eclipse will complain with "Can't find method
>> 'myTestMethodName[0]' opening test class instead".
>>
>> It's not that important - I have been living with this for about a
>> year (!), but finally wondered hey - let's ask around if there's an
>> obvious workaround (a way to overide the test name in the test) or a
>> way to fix this... I'd rather not patch my local junit.
>>
>> (No mention of this in the forums or elsewhere AFAIK).
>>
>> thanks
>>
>> Tim
>>
>
